title: Job: The Wicked Often Prosper
summary: Job challenges the idea that the wicked always suffer. He points out that many evil people live in comfort and die in peace. This contradicts his friends' belief that suffering is always a result of sin.

faq.question: What argument does Job make in this chapter?
faq.answer: That the wicked often live long, successful lives while the righteous suffer.

faq.question: What is Job’s point to his friends?
faq.answer: Their worldview is too simplistic and doesn’t match reality.
